titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph Hemphill Letters, 1898-1923
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Chiefly letters from Hemphill's wife Dora, written in 1908 at the Charleston Navy Yard, primarily relating to her activities and news of mutual friends, many of whom were in the Navy.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Joseph Hemphill letters, 1898-1923, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph Newton Hemphill was Third Squadron commander of the Asiatic Naval Fleet.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Chiefly letters from Hemphill's wife Dora, written in 1908 at the Charleston Navy Yard, primarily relating to her activities and news of mutual friends, many of whom were in the Navy.

controlaccess.subject: Navy spouses
Navy-yards and naval stations -- South Carolina -- Charleston
